sentences.sContent: Fuel is cheaper on the French side of the border.
sentences.sCn: 燃料在边境那边的法国要便宜些。

sentences.sContent: A man stood watching me from the other side of the road.
sentences.sCn: 有个男人站在马路的对面看着我。

sentences.sContent: His friends and family were all on the other side of the world.
sentences.sCn: 他的朋友和家人都在地球的另一边。

sentences.sContent: The restaurant was empty apart from another couple on the far side of the room (= the area that is furthest away from you ) .
sentences.sCn: 饭店里空空的，只有最那边还有一对夫妇。

phrases.pCn: 与…相比；在…旁边；在……的边上
adv. 与...并肩（与...并排；与...同时）

words.tran: 支持（side的现在分词）；给…装上侧面；收拾，整理

trans.tranOther: one of the two areas that are on the left or the right of an imaginary line, or on the left or the right of a border, wall, river etc
to support or argue against a person or group in a quarrel, fight etc
in or on the side of something
